meanings.definition: To organize or arrange in a harmonious way.
meanings.sent1: The team coordinated their efforts to win the game.
meanings.sent2: She coordinated the colors of the room beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The dance was a disaster until they coordinated their steps.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like a well-coordinated symphony of words.
meanings.sent5: The event was successful because everyone coordinated their tasks perfectly.

meanings.definition: Working together in a smooth and effective way.
meanings.sent1: The coordinated team finished the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved in a coordinated manner across the stage.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers looked perfectly coordinated in the pool.
meanings.sent4: The birds flew in a coordinated formation across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The orchestra played a beautifully coordinated piece of music.

meanings.definition: Having parts that match or go well together.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit was perfectly coordinated with her accessories.
meanings.sent2: The furniture in the room was carefully coordinated.
meanings.sent3: The flavors in the dish were not coordinated well.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting were beautifully coordinated.
meanings.sent5: The elements of the design were perfectly coordinated to create a stunning look.
